g.text: Co., Ltd., Shizuoka, Japan), pH 5.5, in a 90-mm disposable sterile Petri dish.
light (FL40SW; NEC Corporation, Tokyo, Japan) in a culture room maintained at
around 22°C with air conditioning. The gemmae/gemmalings subjected to G-AgarTrap
transformation were obtained from one- to two-month-old thalli.
The basic procedure of G-AgarTrap was previously reported
B5 solid medium (1% agar) supplemented with 1% sucrose, pH
5.5, in a 60-mm disposable sterile Petri dish, and pre-cultured into gemmalings. For the
co-culture, 1–3 mL transformation buffer (10 mM MgCl
with the excess being removed after 1 min using an aspirator or micropipette. Four
factors were considered, including sealing of the Petri dish with Parafilm, the
strain used, the addition of a surfactant (0.01–0.1% Tween 20) in the
transformation buffer, and dark treatment during the co-culture period. After
was twice washed from the gemmalings
medium with 1–4 mL sterile water, and then 1 mL selection buffer containing
antibiotics (100 µg hygromycin B and 1 mg Claforan) was poured over the gemmalings
and the solid medium. After culturing for a few weeks, the transformed cells had grown
and the non-transgenic cells had died
